ai.summary: A roughly 8.6 km circular route around Ken Hill in the UK. Rated moderate, it combines fields, tracks and gentle hills, suitable for walkers with intermediate fitness seeking rural scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: The hike combines grassy lanes, loose-surfaced tracks and short stony sections with gentle to moderate elevation. Conditions vary with weather: expect muddiness after rain, gates and occasional stiles, and uneven footing in places. Open sections offer views of the surrounding countryside.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and plan for changing UK weather. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Stay on marked paths, close gates behind you, and watch for livestock. Carry a map or GPS, a charged mobile phone, water and snacks. Tell someone your route and expected return time; be aware that mobile signal can be limited in rural areas.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn; walkable year-round with proper clothing and footing care.

seo.title: Ken Hill Circular Walk – 8.6 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Ken Hill Circular, an 8.6 km moderate hike in the UK. Mixed terrain, rolling hills, and rural scenery—perfect for walkers with intermediate fitness.
